abstract: Hewlett-Packard‘s chief executive, Mark V. Hurd, faced a barrage of contentious questions Tuesday from analysts who seemed to be puzzled by the company’s decision to spend $13.2 billion to buy technology service provider Electronic Data Systems.
lead_paragraph: Hewlett-Packard‘s chief executive, Mark V. Hurd, faced a barrage of contentious questions Tuesday from analysts who seemed to be puzzled by the company’s decision to spend $13.2 billion to buy technology service provider Electronic Data Systems.

headline.main: For Many on Wall Street, H-P Deal Doesn’t Add Up
